title: How to Make Violet Cupcakes

steps.headline: Make the frosting before making the cakes.
steps.description: This is important because the frosting needs time to chill before adding to the cupcakes.

steps.headline: Melt the white chocolate in a bain marie or double boiler.
steps.description: Be careful not to let any water condense into the chocolate.

steps.headline: Add the violet syrup, cream and violet food coloring.
Place the frosting into the refrigerator.
steps.description: It needs to chill for around 2-3 hours before use. After it is chilled, remove it from the fridge and beat it until it looks like stiffened cream.

steps.headline: Make the cupcakes next.
steps.description: First, preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the cupcake cases or cupcake pan as needed.

steps.headline: Crack the eggs into a bowl and add the sugar and vanilla.
Add the oil, milk and violet syrup to the egg mix and stir through.
Add the flour, baking powder and the pinch of salt.
Pour the batter into the cupcake pan or cases.
Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the cupcakes begin to turn a light golden brown.
Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
steps.description: Use a wire cooling rack for cooling.

steps.headline: Once the cupcakes have cooled, spread the frosting over the cupcakes.
steps.description: If you have small sugared violets or marzipan/sugar paste shaped violets, add them to the top of the cupcakes for decorative effect. Alternatively, add real violet flowers, which are are edible or sprinkle violet colored sugar over the cake.

text: Make the frosting before making the cakes. This is important because the frosting needs time to chill before adding to the cupcakes. Melt the white chocolate in a bain marie or double boiler. Be careful not to let any water condense into the chocolate. Add the violet syrup, cream and violet food coloring. Mix together well. Place the frosting into the refrigerator. It needs to chill for around 2-3 hours before use. After it is chilled, remove it from the fridge and beat it until it looks like stiffened cream. Make the cupcakes next. First, preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the cupcake cases or cupcake pan as needed. Crack the eggs into a bowl and add the sugar and vanilla. Beat together until fluffy. Add the oil, milk and violet syrup to the egg mix and stir through.  Add the flour, baking powder and the pinch of salt. Combine. Pour the batter into the cupcake pan or cases.  Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the cupcakes begin to turn a light golden brown.  Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Use a wire cooling rack for cooling. Once the cupcakes have cooled, spread the frosting over the cupcakes. If you have small sugared violets or marzipan/sugar paste shaped violets, add them to the top of the cupcakes for decorative effect. Alternatively, add real violet flowers, which are are edible or sprinkle violet colored sugar over the cake.
